title: Non-text Content
description: All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose.
howToMeet: Provide alt text for all images that convey information
Use empty alt="" for decorative images
Provide text alternatives for icons and graphics
Include captions or transcripts for audio/video content
commonMistakes: Missing alt text on informative images
Using "image" or filename as alt text
Not marking decorative images with empty alt
Alt text that doesn't convey the purpose of the image

title: Contrast (Minimum)
description: Text and images of text have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, except for large text (3:1), incidental text, and logos.
howToMeet: Use color contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text
Use color contrast ratio of 3:1 for large text (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold)
Test contrast with automated tools like Stark or WebAIM
Ensure contrast in all states (default, hover, focus, disabled)
commonMistakes: Light gray text on white backgrounds
Not testing contrast on different backgrounds

title: Contrast (Enhanced)
description: Text and images of text have a contrast ratio of at least 7:1, except for large text (4.5:1), incidental text, and logos.
howToMeet: Use color contrast ratio of 7:1 for normal text
Use color contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for large text
Provide high contrast mode option
Test with users who have low vision
commonMistakes: Assuming AA contrast is sufficient for all users
Ignoring enhanced contrast for important content

title: Non-text Contrast
description: UI components and graphical objects have a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against adjacent colors.
howToMeet: Ensure form inputs have 3:1 contrast with background
Icons and graphics have 3:1 contrast
Focus indicators have 3:1 contrast
Test buttons, inputs, and interactive elements
commonMistakes: Light gray borders on white backgrounds
Subtle focus indicators with low contrast

title: Keyboard
description: All functionality is available from a keyboard without requiring specific timings.
howToMeet: Ensure all interactive elements are keyboard accessible
Test navigation with Tab, Enter, Space, Arrow keys
Provide keyboard shortcuts for common actions
Don't trap keyboard focus
commonMistakes: Dropdowns that can't be navigated with keyboard
Using div/span for buttons instead of button element

good: Dropdown navigable with arrow keys and Enter
Modal with focus trap and Esc to close
bad: Custom dropdown only works with mouse

title: Focus Order
description: Components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
howToMeet: Follow logical DOM order for focus
Don't use positive tabindex values
Test focus order matches visual order
Ensure focus moves logically through components
commonMistakes: Visual order differs from DOM order

good: Natural DOM order for focus flow

title: Focus Visible
description: Any keyboard operable interface has a mode where the focus indicator is visible.
howToMeet: Never remove focus outlines without providing alternatives
Use clear, high-contrast focus indicators
Ensure focus indicator is at least 3:1 contrast
Test focus visibility on all backgrounds
commonMistakes: Focus indicator same color as background
Focus indicator too subtle or thin

good: Clear visual indication on all focusable elements
bad: Focus indicator only on some elements

title: Name, Role, Value
description: For all UI components, the name and role can be programmatically determined, and states/properties can be programmatically set.
howToMeet: Use semantic HTML elements (button, input, nav, etc.)
Add ARIA labels where semantic HTML isn't sufficient
Ensure custom components have proper ARIA roles
Test with screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)

title: Info and Relationships
description: Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.
howToMeet: Use proper heading hierarchy (h1-h6)
Use semantic HTML for lists, tables, forms
Label form inputs properly
Use ARIA landmarks for page regions
commonMistakes: Using visual styling instead of semantic elements
Not using list elements for lists

title: Target Size (Minimum)
description: The size of the target for pointer inputs is at least 24 by 24 CSS pixels.
howToMeet: Make touch targets at least 24x24px (44x44px recommended)
Provide adequate spacing between interactive elements
Ensure clickable area matches visual size
Test on mobile devices
commonMistakes: Forgetting touch target size on mobile

bad: Small checkbox without label click area

title: Redundant Entry
description: Information previously entered by or provided to the user is auto-populated or available for selection.
howToMeet: Use autocomplete attributes on form fields
Remember user data within session
Provide selection options for repeated data
Don't force users to re-enter information

good: Auto-fill shipping as billing address option
